intro: Rudgea inflata, commonly known as the inflated rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Rudgea inflata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
